description: From Ancient Greek ἐπίβλημα (epíblēma, “cover”); ἐπί (epí, “over, upon”) + βάλλω (bállō, “throw”).

entries.meaning: (botany) The epidermal cells of rootlets, specially adapted to absorb liquids.
examples: These epidermal cells of the root, taken collectively, have been called the Epiblema
